title: Justice Department Looks for Ways to Challenge Texas Abortion Law
summary: Attorney General Garland says DOJ will enforce a federal law prohibiting people from threatening or preventing women seeking abortions. The Justice Department won't tolerate violence or threats against people seeking abortions in Texas, U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said, as the Biden administration considers ways to challenge a new state law banning most abortions.

title: Reclaiming Our Independence From Big Tech
summary: Companies that censor political speech, harm competition and ruin our brains need regulation.. Google can swing an election. Facebook knows more about you than your spouse does. Amazon 's Alexa can record your living room conversations. Yet for all the talk about the Big Tech threat, these companies keep getting bigger, more powerful and more abusive.

title: Identity Politics Goes Global
summary: Multi-ethnic states from South Africa to Central Asia are starting to come apart.. Preoccupied by the pandemic, climate change and the intensifying rivalry between the U.S. and China, policy makers and pundits aren't paying enough attention to the news in Africa. That is a mistake. What is happening on the continent offers insights into the destructive role identity politics seems destined to play in world politics.

title: Is Moderna the Tortoise in the Vaccine Race?
summary: It seems to be more effective than Pfizer, perhaps because of the later second shot.. President Trump's Operation Warp speed was often likened to the Manhattan Project, but this time the Americans and the Germans were on the same side. Germany had the BioNTech mRNA vaccine, backed by Pfizer ; the U.S. had the Moderna shot, based on research conducted at a National Institutes of Health lab. The shots seemed so similar that Anthony Fauci, despite taking pride in the NIH's work, told me he couldn't choose between them.

title: The Real Structural Racism
summary: Is it OK that black eighth graders aren't proficient in math and reading?. Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez may have a point about structural racism. But it's probably not the point the Queens Democrat and her progressive allies think it is.

title: Notable & Quotable: Tearing Down Princeton
summary: Free speech, but only to supply students 'with the tools with which they can tear down this place.'. Dan-el Padilla Peralta, associate professor of classics, in a video shown at Princeton University's freshman orientation:

title: 'The Antisocial Network' Review: Let Them Eat Shorts
summary: GameStop's small investors focused on the fact that, with every dollar the stock rose, well-to-do short sellers were losing money.. Until late last year, GameStop was a typical and not very successful corporation. The company sold videogames through a chain of retail outlets and lost money on every sale. But its stock caught the interest of small investors who traded on Robinhood, a mobile trading app, and the stock began to levitate.

title: Two Young Afghan Sisters' Journey Across Afghanistan to Escape the Taliban
summary: Resume Subscription. Taliban fighters armed with AK-47s fired warning shots over the heaving crowd at the entrance to Kabul airport. Fourteen-year-old Maryam Mohammadi shuddered. Her 3-year-old sister, Mehrsa, started to cry. "Don't be scared," the older girl said. "It's just a game."

title: 'Shang-Chi' Flies to a Record Labor Day at the Box Office
summary: Moviegoers showed up for the first Asian superhero star of a Marvel film in the theater-only debut. Walt Disney Co. 's "Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings" broke records for the highest-grossing film for the four-day Labor Day weekend, making $90 million in the U.S. and Canada, according to industry estimates.

title: Our Friends the Taliban
summary: Biden is relying on the group with ties to al Qaeda. Good luck.. The Taliban claimed Monday to have conquered the last major opposition to its takeover of Afghanistan, routing remnants of the former Afghan military and others in the Panjshir Valley. No doubt the abandoned U.S. military equipment helped. Let's hope the Talibs feel grateful-because the Biden Administration plans to depend on them for years to come.

title: 'We Once Again Urge . . . '
summary: The Houthis ignore Antony Blinken one more time. He objects, strenuously.. This is getting to be a habit, and an embarrassing one. An adversary courted by the Biden Administration ignores U.S. pleas and continues waging war against an ally, and the Biden State Department issues a stern lecture in a press release.

title: Kavanaugh to the Liberal Rescue
summary: Democrats discover that a private right of action without injury is unfair.. Democrats are up in arms over a Texas abortion law they say creates a "vigilante system" by deputizing private citizens to enforce it. What do you know, they seem to have discovered the wisdom of the Supreme Court conservatives who recently limited vigilantism by plaintiff attorneys in federal courts.

title: New York Trashes Landlords Again
summary: Albany passes another eviction ban that may violate the Constitution.. The Supreme Court last month partially blocked New York's eviction moratorium, but Democrats in Albany shrugged off the rebuke and last week enacted another ban that goes through Jan. 15. The new ban raises fresh constitutional issues, so the Justices may get another bite at this big apple.

title: Does Joe Biden Have Any Core Principles?
summary: Leadership hasn't been a hallmark of his long political career. His real talent is following the herd.. Someone once said of a British politician of notably flexible moral principles that his frequent wrestling bouts with his conscience must have constituted one of the longest winning streaks in sporting history.

title: Shot-Up SUVs, Teens on Checkpoints: A Reporter's Return to Kabul
summary: Trip through Taliban-ruled Afghanistan showcases profound change coexisting with remnants of the fallen republic, for now. KABUL-Clad in body armor and helmets, Uzbekistan's border guards took positions in the middle of the bridge spanning the wide Amu Darya river on Monday morning, examining the papers of a handful of Afghans coming their way. Beyond them, the Taliban's new Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan began.

title: Forget Netflix, Some Movie Fans Rewind to VHS Tapes
summary: 'Free Blockbuster' movement helps with a difficult hobby; 'an art form in many ways'. When Nicole Wiegand wants to relax, she reaches back to 1987.

title: Labor Day (Tuesday, September 7)
Rapes of U.S.-Bound Migrants Make a Treacherous Route More Dangerous
summary: Resume Subscription. BAJO CHIQUITO, Panama-The thick jungles of Panama's Darién Gap have long been a treacherous part of the journey for many migrants trying to make their way to the U.S. from South America.

title: More College-Educated Women Are Having Babies Outside Marriage
summary: While nonmarital childbearing has risen across the board, women with college degrees have seen the sharpest increase. Nearly a quarter of highly educated women in their mid-30s had their first babies outside marriage, according to new research published Monday in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences.

title: Ida-Hit Areas Grapple With Recovery
summary: More than half of New Orleans had electricity Monday; Biden declares New York and New Jersey major disasters.

title: As Investors Jump In, U.S.-Stock Funds Rise 19.3% for the Year
summary: Record individual-investor inflows into U.S. stocks along with ETFs during the summer helped to boost the market. Like summer surfers, stocks have continued to zoom past the dangers. And fund investors are willing to ride it out.

title: A Generation of American Men Give Up on College
summary: Resume Subscription. Men are abandoning higher education in such numbers that they now trail female college students by record levels.

title: Boeing Dreamliner Delivery Likely Delayed Until October
summary: FAA rejected plane maker's recent inspection proposal; customers may get chance to redo orders as halt lingers. Deliveries of Boeing Co. 's 787 Dreamliner will likely remain halted until at least late October as the plane maker has been unable to persuade air-safety regulators to approve its proposal to inspect the aircraft, people familiar with the matter said.

title: U.S. Stock Futures, Overseas Markets Rise
summary: Investors weigh strong earnings against likely reduction in central banks' stimulus measures. U.S. stock futures and major overseas markets rose Monday in quiet trading, with American stock and bond markets closed for Labor Day.

title: Hurricane Ida Leaves Louisianans Without Power, New York State Seeking Disaster Declaration
summary: Parts of Louisiana and the Northeast still grappling with the aftermath of the storm. A week after Hurricane Ida made landfall, parts of Louisiana and the Northeast are still grappling with the deadly storm's aftermath, and life in some areas isn't expected to return to normal for weeks.

title: Aluminum Hits Decade High After Guinea Coup
summary: Mineral-rich West African Nation is a major producer of bauxite, crucial for aluminum manufacturing. Aluminum prices rose to their highest level in 10 years Monday after a military coup in mineral-rich Guinea threatened to snarl the lightweight metal's supply chain.

title: Dissembling Won't Fix Biden's Afghan Mess
summary: The president has surrounded himself with yes-men. All in favor of ending an "endless" or "forever" war, raise your hand. Wow, it's unanimous. All in favor of prosperity, motherhood and apple pie? Wow, it's unanimous again. You have to admire the Biden administration's ability to use buzzwords to frame questions in support of its narrative ("A Dishonest Afghan Accounting," Review and Outlook, Sept. 1).

title: Taliban Claim to Have Conquered Last Pocket of Resistance in Afghanistan
summary: Group releases images it says show the conquest of the provincial capital of Panjshir. The Taliban claimed Monday to have overcome the last pocket of resistance in Afghanistan, releasing images they said showed the conquest of the provincial capital of Panjshir, a region that has held out against the group's takeover of the country.

title: Lithuania and the Holocaust: A Dark History
summary: Local collaborators were among Hitler's most loyal henchmen in annihilating Jews.. Rather than being reviled by Lithuanians as "a traitor" for exposing her grandfather's role in murdering Jews ("My Grandfather's Crimes Against Humanity," op-ed, Aug. 26), Silvia Foti merits praise for revealing the truth.

title: Traders Return to London Metal Exchange's 144-Year-Old Ring
summary: Storied trading pit for setting global metal prices reopened with vaccines, tests and hand sanitizer to try to prevent a Covid-19 outbreak. Traders returned to the London Metal Exchange's storied ring in a test of the City of London's ability to bring back workers.

title: No More 'Dual Mandate.' Let the Fed Focus on Sound Money
summary: Congress has outsourced economic policy.. It is refreshing to read Judy Shelton's clearheaded analysis of the current muddle of monetary and economic policies of our federal government ("Congress Needs to Rein In a Too-Powerful Federal Reserve," op-ed, Sept. 2). Ms. Shelton makes many good points but the main one is how, by outsourcing economic policy to the Fed, "Congress has absolved itself of responsibility for its own complicity in financing excess government spending."

title: Is John Bolton Nostalgic Yet for Trump's Foreign Policy?
summary: The former president was right on nearly every major national-security issue.. In "Russia and China Eye a Retreating U.S." (op-ed, Aug. 31), John Bolton provides excellent foreign-policy advice to the Biden administration regarding countering Chinese ambitions, checking Russian aggression, demanding that NATO members pay their fair share and staying away from the Iran nuclear deal. But this seeming nostalgia for the good old days of President Trump's foreign policy is inconsistent with Mr. Bolton's propensity to punctuate nearly every speech, interview, article and (presumably) thought with some sort of dig at Mr. Trump's handling of foreign policy.

title: Welcome Afghan Refugees, but Vet Them First
summary: Many Republicans object to what we saw in Kabul.. I've listened carefully to Stephen Miller, Tucker Carlson and other Republicans over recent days. Contrary to William Galston's claim that "Doing the Honorable Thing Divides the GOP" (Politics & Ideas, Sept. 1), each of the "pro-Trump" Republicans that I've heard agrees that America should welcome Afghans who risked their lives working for us and to whom we made-and President Biden has broken-promises of safety.

title: Miami Herald Defends Its Reporting on Florida Covid Data
summary: The Florida Department of Health does not publish its methodology or explain what it means by 'new deaths.'. In "There's No Mystery in Florida's Covid Reporting" (op-ed, Sept. 1), Phil Kerpen, president of the Committee to Unleash Prosperity and CEO of American Commitment, states that the Miami Herald's coverage was "particularly dishonest." I cannot let this go unchallenged.

title: After Covid-19 Lockdowns, Children Struggle to Rekindle Close Friendships
summary: Such friendships are crucial, experts say, in helping create a road map for successful adult relationships. Months into virtual school last year, Elyssa Katz witnessed her son Noah, age 9, start to lose interest in his best friend. Since the two couldn't see each other as often, it was harder for them to keep in touch; she worried he felt lonely without his go-to friend by his side.

title: BlackRock's China Blunder
summary: Pouring billions into the country now is a bad investment and imperils U.S. national security.. BlackRock, the world's largest asset manager, has begun a major initiative in China. On Aug. 30 it launched a set of mutual funds and other investment products for Chinese consumers. The New York-based firm is the first foreign-owned company allowed to do so. The launch came just weeks after BlackRock recommended that investors triple their allocations in Chinese assets. This will push billions of dollars into China. "The Chinese market represents a significant opportunity to help meet the long-term goals of investors in China and internationally," BlackRock Chairman Larry Fink wrote in a letter to shareholders.

title: A Sanction Worth Lifting in Cuba
summary: Under the island's military dictatorship, it's illegal to fish for dinner.. Reprisals carried out by storm troopers and secret police against participants in Cuba's July 11 uprising have been widely condemned, including by President Biden. But the international left is trying to help Cuba's military dictatorship recover from this public-relations disaster by blaming the U.S. for the island's misery.

title: Directors of Apple Daily Publisher Quit, Citing National-Security Crackdown
summary: The resigning directors of Next Digital, which recently closed the pro-democracy newspaper founded by jailed tycoon Jimmy Lai, said officials forced the company out of business. HONG KONG-The four remaining directors of a publishing company that recently closed the pro-democracy Apple Daily newspaper founded by jailed tycoon Jimmy Lai resigned, saying authorities forced the company into liquidation while bypassing the courts.

title: Gymnastics Isn't in the Paralympics-and There Is Little Momentum to Change That
summary: Disabled gymnasts compete and often create viral performances. But the sport's officials say they aren't mounting a Paralympic bid for now.. Gymnastics was the marquee event of the Summer Olympic Games in Tokyo, so popular that some U.S. TV viewers rose very early to watch it live. Yet the sport didn't get any airtime during the Paralympic Games a few weeks later-because it wasn't in them.

title: Belarus Jails One of Its Last Leading Dissidents for 11 Years
summary: Most opposition leaders have fled after Alexander Lukashenko launched a brutal crackdown following last year's disputed presidential vote. MOSCOW-A Belarusian activist who avoided deportation by tearing up her passport last year was sentenced to 11 years in prison on a variety of charges, including plotting to oust the country's leader, Alexander Lukashenko, effectively silencing the last main opposition voice still in the country.

title: Democrats Bet Legislative Success Will Bring Political Rewards
summary: The party believes an ambitious domestic agenda will help it win next year's midterms, but Republicans see overreach. One of the great political gambles of recent times is playing out right now, in full view: Democrats are attempting to pass the most ambitious domestic agenda in memory with the smallest margin of congressional control in two decades.

title: Israel Launches Manhunt After Palestinian Militants Escape From Prison
summary: Jailbreak adds pressure on new Prime Minister Naftali Bennett as he attempts to shore up his security credentials. TEL AVIV-Israeli forces launched a search for a Palestinian militant leader and five other inmates who staged an elaborate escape from a high security prison, raising political pressure on Prime Minister Naftali Bennett as he attempts to burnish his security credentials after leading a wide-ranging new coalition to power in June.

title: Help Kids Cope With Back-to-School Stress
summary: Parents can look for signs of anxiety and help with new routines after 18 months of unstructured life. Students are facing more than standard back-to-school anxiety this fall.

title: The New Head of the International Accounting Standards Board Outlines His Priorities
summary: Andreas Barckow became chairman of the global accounting rule maker in July. The new head of the International Accounting Standards Board is setting his priorities for the rule maker, including potentially changing requirements around intangible assets and weighing in on sustainability disclosure.

title: Among 9/11 Survivors, Health Effects Linger
summary: Resume Subscription. Dana Nelson was sitting in English class on the ninth floor of Stuyvesant High School on Sept. 11, 2001, when the first plane hit the World Trade Center. Then 14 years old, she watched from the window of her classroom with her classmates. Like hundreds of thousands of others in Manhattan that day, she fled through a cloud of toxic dust and debris. A month later, she returned to class in that same building.

title: 9/11 Triggered a Homeland-Security Industrial Complex That Endures
summary: Resume Subscription. WASHINGTON-The attacks of Sept. 11, 2001, led policy makers to embark on one of the largest spending binges in federal government history, transforming the private sector, the Washington metropolitan area and Americans' relationship with their government.

title: They Lost Their Fathers on Sept. 11. Then They Found Each Other.
summary: Resume Subscription. The first time they met, Edward Seaman and Julia Coombs were attending a camp in Belfast, Ireland, for teenagers who had lost parents to terrorism.

title: The Children of 9/11 Remember the Pain of Losing Parents
summary: Resume Subscription. Nearly 3,000 children lost parents in the deadly attacks on Sept. 11.

title: Canada's Swaggering Teen Star of the U.S. Open
summary: After stunning Naomi Osaka and Angelique Kerber, Canadian 19-year-old Leylah Fernandez is into the quarterfinals of a Grand Slam for the first time.. Leylah Fernandez has long carried the tennis-player habit of looking to her coaches and family after enormous points. The difference for her in New York, even at 18, is that Fernandez wasn't looking for reassurance.

title: Big Boeing Customer Says It Is Walking Away From New MAX Order
summary: Irish low-cost giant Ryanair says plane maker won't drop prices enough to win deal. LONDON- Ryanair Holdings PLC, Boeing Co. 's biggest customer outside of the U.S., said it is walking away from talks with the U.S. jet maker over a potential new order for the 737 MAX in a dispute over pricing.

title: Tech Advances Put the Annual Doctor Visit on the Critical List
summary: Resume Subscription. Author

title: U.S. Left Afghanistan Littered With Decaying Factories, Schools
summary: Watchdog finds government wasted at least $2.4 billion on assets that were unused, destroyed or poorly maintained. The Afghan countryside is littered with abandoned and decaying power plants, prisons, schools, factories, office buildings and military bases, according to a watchdog agency, the legacy of the U.S.'s 20-year effort to fund the establishment of a modern Afghan state that could provide security and basic services for its citizens.

title: Is the Stock Market Open for Labor Day? Here's What You Need to Know About the Federal Holiday
summary: The first Monday in September is one of nine days that the market closes during the year. Before Labor Day became a U.S. federal holiday, it was celebrated in the late 19th century by activists and individual states, according to the U.S. Department of Labor.

title: Delta Variant Trips Up NYC Labor Day Return to Normal
summary: Summer increase in Covid-19 cases prompts many employers in city to delay the resumption of office work. New York City officials hoped the week after Labor Day would represent a return to normalcy in the city's major business districts.

title: Chinese Tech Giant JD.com Founder Richard Liu to Step Back From Daily Business
summary: E-commerce company names its first president facing tougher competition, Beijing's regulatory crackdown. Chinese e-commerce group JD.com Inc. named its first president Monday, paving the way for founder and Chief Executive Richard Liu to step back from day-to-day business to focus on longer-term strategy and mentoring young managers.

title: Biden Seeks to Shift Focus to Domestic Issues After Afghanistan Exit
summary: White House plans to spend September pushing for passage of the president's agenda, as he faces falling poll numbers. WASHINGTON-President Biden is seeking to press his legislative agenda and redouble efforts to combat the Covid-19 pandemic after Labor Day but the tumultuous withdrawal from Afghanistan may cast a long shadow over the fall.

title: After Decades Supporting the Flight 93 Memorial, a Mother Looks Ahead
summary: Resume Subscription. On the morning of Sept. 11, 2001, Deborah Borza knelt near the altar at Mary, Star of the Sea Catholic Church in San Diego. She prayed while waiting to hear whether her 20-year-old daughter was aboard a hijacked plane.

title: Why Vaccines Are Competitive Advantages for NFL Teams in 2021
summary: The NFL's second pandemic season begins this week, and the teams with a higher percentage of vaccinated players aren't just better protected against the virus. They have a competitive advantage on the field.. When Tom Brady dusted confetti off his championship T-shirt for the seventh time at the end of the Super Bowl in February, the partially filled seats at Raymond James Stadium included 7,500 healthcare workers who were already vaccinated against Covid-19.

title: This Year's Cannabis Deals Look Safer Than the Last Crop
summary: Recent M&A might provide a welcome boost for U.S. marijuana growers' weak share prices. An early wave of cannabis mergers and acquisitions burned investors. A fresh round is now under way, but they have other things to worry about than history repeating itself.

title: Goldman Sachs's Petershill Plans London Listing
summary: Listing would cash in on a boom for private equity, raising $750 million and valuing the vehicle at more than $5 billion. LONDON-Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s Petershill Partners said Monday it plans to list an investment vehicle on the London Stock Exchange , taking advantage of a sizzling market for private equity.

title: Action on Climate Change Is Urged by Medical Journals in Unprecedented Plea
summary: Rising temperatures threaten 'catastrophic harm to health that will be impossible to reverse,' editors of 220 journals from around the world say. Editors of 220 leading medical, nursing and public-health journals from around the world called for urgent action on climate change, in a joint editorial published on Sunday.

title: College-Town Economy Hopes for a Boost, if Delta Variant Can Be Held at Bay
summary: Resume Subscription. AMHERST, Mass.-This college town is bustling again, fueling hopes that the return of many students to its campuses will bring a collective sigh of economic relief.

title: Why a Covid Vaccine for Children Is Taking So Long
summary: Resume Subscription. SOUTH EUCLID, Ohio-The countdown started as soon as researchers removed the Covid-19 vaccine vials from the freezer at Senders Pediatrics. They had just two hours once the vials thawed to prepare the shots and give them to young children in the clinical trial.

title: Business Travel Rebound Stifled by Covid Resurgence
summary: Companies were counting on corporate travelers to return this fall, but more businesses are keeping workers home. Companies are delaying sending employees back on the road this fall amid another surge in coronavirus cases.

title: Instacart Goes Deeper Into Digital Advertising as Grocery Delivery Slows
summary: CEO Fidji Simo is leading Instacart to expand in digital consumer-products advertising, going up against supermarkets and tech giants. Instacart Inc. wants to do more than just deliver your yogurt and snacks-it wants to advertise them, too.

title: Marie Kondo Lets the Wind Purify Her Home
summary: Hacks and tips from the guru of decluttering: Marie Kondo on her Monday air-purifying routine, avoiding a puffy face and whether all those celebrities skipping baths are right.. Marie Kondo prefers gentle exercise. She does some yoga a couple of times a week and always stretches before bedtime. One of her go-to stretches is for her upper arms: It's called the penguin exercise because you stand up, lock your elbows down straight, angle your wrists out and flap your arms in and out, like a penguin. Kondo, 36, demonstrated the move for me over a Zoom call in August. "I get a little too exhausted from anything rigorous," she says. "It tires me out."

title: You-Yes, You-Can Become a Morning Person Now
summary: Most Popular News. First I was waiting until the kids went back to daycare. Then the deadline was the return to the office, which never came.
